titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Center for Instructional Development and Distance Education (CIDDE), University of Pittsburgh, Photograph Collection, 1986-2005 UA.15.38.1
titlestmt.author: Megan Hedges and Miriam Meislik.

note.p: Original finding aid created by Megan Hedges with revisions and additional content by Miriam Meislik.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:02:50 -0400.

did.unittitle: Center for Instructional Development and Distance Education (CIDDE), University of Pittsburgh, Photograph Collection

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Pittsburgh. Center for Instructional Development and Distance Education

physdesc.extent: (160 volumes containing approximately 634,000 negatives, 8,800 proof sheets and prints, 1,812 CDs of digital images, and 1 records center box)

did.abstract: The Center for Instructional Development and Distance Education (CIDDE) Photographic Services department provides the University of Pittsburgh community with support for its instruction, institutional, and research missions through location and studio photography. Photographs focus on special events, portraiture, general university buildings, student activities, public relations, sports and stock photography. Popular topics include the Chancellor, Pitt Football, Pitt Basketball, and high profile visitors. This collection consists of photographic negatives, 35mm slides, digital images, and contact sheets taken between 1986 and 2005.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The content is arranged into three series within 160 archival binders as created by CIDDE. All items bear an assigned job number and accompanying job request slip. Scope and Contents Notes are included to provide context as to the topics covered in each series and subseries.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Photography services at the University of Pittsburgh most likely existed as early as the late 1960s or early 1970s; however, no exact date is known for the establishment of an official department. The earliest information regarding the creation of a Photographic Services department dates to 1977. Prior to the formation of a singular department, two different University departments offered photographic services. One was the Communication Center located in G-20 Hillman Library whose photographers were located on the 9th floor of the Cathedral of Learning. This group was managed by Charles Hughes. The second group, known as Medical Media Services, was located in Scaife Hall. This group consisted of film makers and photographers notably; Pittsburgh photographer Herb Ferguson served as the manager.

Sometime in late 1977 or early 1978 the Communication Center and the Medical Media Services groups were combined to form the University Center for Instructional Resources (UCIR) under the direction of Dr. J. Fred Gage. The newly formed UCIR also had a graphics unit.

Effective July 1, 1995 UCIR merged with the University External Studies Program (UESP), the Technology and Evaluation Center of Academic Computing, and the Office of Faculty Development to form the University Center for Instructional Development & Distance Education (CIDDE). Also included were the learning laboratories of the Graduate School of Library Science. The goal was to facilitate learning and teaching processes through the provision of educational technology and resources. Photographic Services was relocated from Scaife Hall to its present location in the Information Sciences Building in the fall of 1989. In the mid to late 1990s Photographic Services began the transition from film to digital photography and began using digital cameras exclusively in the early 2000s. Digital photography has now completely superseded and replaced film-based photography at CIDDE.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: All rights reserved. University of Pittsburgh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photographs taken by the Center for Instructional Development and Distance Education (CIDDE) Photographic Services department whose mission is to provide the University of Pittsburgh community with support for its instruction, institutional, and research missions through location and studio photography. Photographs in this collection were taken between 1986 and 2005 and focus on activities of the Chancellor, special events, portraiture, high profile visitors, university buildings, student activities, public relations, sports and stock photography. The bulk of the collection contains 35mm negatives, 120mm negatives, 4x5 negatives, 35mm slides, proof sheets, contact prints, and CDs of digital photographs.
A searchable electronic inventory arranged by job number is available to archives staff to provide more in-depth searching of subjects. Information here duplicates what appears on the job slips.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Center for Instructional Development and Distance Education (CIDDE), University of Pittsburgh, Photograph Collection, 1986-2005, UA.15.38.1, University Archives, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Center for Instructional Development and Distance Education (CIDDE), University of Pittsburgh, Photograph Collection, 1986-2005, UA.15.38.1, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs taken by Kimberly Pasko between December 1988 and January 1997. The subjects covered include: Portraits, Theatre, Sports, Awards, Guest Speakers, Check Presentations, Convocations, Receptions, Board of Trustees, Provost's Inaugural Lecture, Alumni Events, Graduations, Homecoming, Jewish Community Center, Duquesne Club, Fred Rogers, Bradford Campus, Titusville Campus, Semester at Sea, Speaker Series, Career Fair, Turkish Delegates, Lantern Night, and Dr. Thomas E. Starzl Lecture Series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs taken by Michelle Ray between August 2001 and May 2002. The subjects covered include: Portraits, Sports, Jazz Concerts, Theatre, Board of Trustees, Alumni Events, Provost's Lecture Series, Science 2001, Pitt Day, Convocations, Move In Day, Media Day, Stock Photographs, Graduations, Orchestra, Dean's Day, Match Day, Legacy Laureate, and Robert Moore Symposium.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs taken by Curtis Reeves between April 1997 and May 1997. The subjects covered include: Portraits, visiting speaker Salman Rushdie, Lectures, Theatre, Outsourcing Conference, Check Presentations, Scaife Hall Lecture Series, Alumni Dinner, Provost's Lecture Series, Engineering Research, IMDI Group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs taken by Sue Wrbican between September 1991 and July 1994. The subjects covered include: Portraits, Gordon Foundation Breakfast, Sports, Keg Roll, visiting speaker Nelson Mandela, IBM Ribbon Cutting, H.J. Heinz Company Foundation Fellows, ROTC Protest, Reception for August Wilson, Alumni Events, Reception for the Secretary to the Commonwealth, Graduations, Young Writers Workshop, Darlington Library, Howard Hughes Fellows, Titusville Campus, Parents Day, CAS 50th Reunion 1993, Semester at Sea, Schenley Cafe, Carnegie Science Center, Provost's Lecture Series, Architectural Shots, Object Shots, and Decades Studio Shots.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs taken by Jim Krandel between 1989 and 1993. The subjects covered include: Portraits, Check Presentations, Award Presentations, the Heinz Lecture Series with Henry Kissinger, Fulbright Professor, AT&T Computer Lab, Video Production and Control Room, and Dean Ferrerier Retirement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs taken September 1997 and May 2002. The subjects covered include: Portraits, Theatre, Sports, Gamelan, Jazz Festival, Nationality Rooms, Provost Dinner, Foreign Dignitaries, Miracle of Miracles, Bike Fair, Dean's Retreat, Monte Carlo Night, Pitt Ambassadors, ROTC Ball, Chancellors Weekend, Convocations, Secretary of Labor, Black History Month Lecture, Falk Library Dedication, Conferences, Homecoming, Student Kickoff, Masonic Temple Tour, Simmons Symposium, President of Turkey, Dr. Thomas E. Starzl Lecture Series, Elmer H. Grimm Sr. Pharmacy Museum, Retirement Receptions, Drue Heinz Lecture Series, Mellon Hall Ribbon Cutting, Posvar Hall Dedication, Kennywood, Blue and Gold Ceremony, Same Sex Benefits Protest, 50th Reunion Dinner 1997, 50th Reunion Luncheon 2000, Fanfest, Discovery Weekend, Mayor of Macedonia, Mothman Diaries Set, White Coat Ceremony, Graduations, Student Day of Caring, and Petersen Event Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs taken by Zsuzsi Matolcsy between December 1990 and April 1995. The subjects covered include: Board of Trustees, Graduations, Receptions, 50th Reunion 1992, Sports, Kwanzaa Celebration, Retirement Receptions, Alumni Events, Chancellor's Reception, Nationality Rooms, Founder's Day, Pitt Ambassadors, Bipolar Disorder Conference, Homecoming Brunch, and Martin Luther King Jr. Program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes

The subjects covered include: Fawcett Commons Dedication, Sports, Annual Board Meeting, Alumni Events, Debate, Commencements, Graduations, Awards, Retirement Receptions, Heinz Lecture Series, Day of Caring, Katz Leadership Conference, and the Annual Henry T. Bahnson Lecture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs taken by Jason Blair between May 2005 and August 2005. The subjects covered include: 1787 Society Lunch, Portraits, Alumni Events, Teaching Times, Digital Library, Falcon, Special Olympics, and H.J. Heinz Company Foundation Fellows.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs taken by Shawn Brackbill in 1997. The subjects covered include: Jazz Festival and Stock Photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes

Bush, and Legacy Laureate Tour.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs taken by various CIDDE photographers between January 2002 and October 2005. Subjects include: Portraits, Convocations, visit of President George W. Bush, Picnics, Luncheons, Dinners, Graduations, Lecture Laureate Programs, Southside Complex, Sports, Press Conferences, Panel Discussions, Alumni Events, Dean Scholarship Ball, Retirement Receptions, Coaches and Coach Family Shots, Heinz Lecture Series, Awards Dinners, Campus Stock Photographs, Cameos of Caring, Schenley Park, Petersen Event Center, Peregrine Falcon, Board of Trustee Events, Team Pittsburgh, Pitt Magazine, A.W. Leroy Irvis, Elmer H. Grimm Sr. Pharmacy Museum, Heinz Field, Light Up Night, and Kennywood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs taken by various CIDDE photographers between 1986 and 2001. The subjects include: Miscellaneous and Stock Slides (9 binders and 1 misc. box), Cathedral of Learning Stock Slides, Chatauqua at Pitt (3 binders), Discovery Weekend, Sports, Football, The Last Game at Pitt Stadium, First Day at Heinz Field, Foster Project, Law Professor Portraits, and University Buildings.
